1542.title: Volteer/Malefor?

choices: Volteer grows as huge as the statue. He can grow at will!
The statue shrinks down to his size. He can control the size of others!
15421.content:
“Gnngh, this day’s just been going so slowly. All I wanted to do is tell Cyril about the remarkable status on Spyro’s progression. The necessity to freeze my tongue to the roof of my mouth wasn’t there; I couldn’t even taste my favorite berries off the bushes in the forest my tongue was so numb…”

The large yellow and blue electric dragon sluggishly trudged through the temple halls with his head and long neck low. Boredom was his biggest enemy, at least in the non-physical aspect, and was really settling in on him during this particular afternoon. By nature he was a talker with a highly analytical mind, the most intelligent of the 4 elemental guardians, thus he disliked being alone and always wanted someone to engage with on virtually any subject matter possible. While Volteer was a venerable ally and friend due to this trait, his motor mouth was at times his biggest weakness, but it wasn’t for not being able to keep a secret. On more than one occasion he would get passed back and forth between Ignitus, Cyril and Terrador to get some peace once their patience eroded. Ignitus and Terrador were usually more mellow on showing they were reaching their breaking points, Cyril not so much. With Terrador off somewhere training with Spyro and Ignitus taking a nap with his door locked, for the past couple hours Cyril had his hands full as Volteer’s main target. Drifting from place to place all over the temple, to him it was as if Volteer jabbered relentlessly without even a pause to breathe, even here in the library!
“You stupid ignoramus! Don’t you ever stop blabbering!? Shut up and leave me be you lowly dragon! Get out! Leave!! SHOO!!!”

The snarling words that reverberated off the library walls made Volteer instantly trip up on his words in a bumbling, stammering attempt at an apology, however Cyril wanted no part of it and gave him truly the cold shoulder by blowing some bitterly cold air into the electric dragon’s mouth, more than enough of an incentive to leave. Fast forward another half an hour and it’s back to the present moment of Volteer lumbering lazily to a place where he hoped would satiate the need to curb his boredom. Inside a somewhat small structure, he steps into completely circular room that also had another arched opening across from the very one the drake entered, a subtle beam creeps onto his face at the small body of green water positioned in the room’s center. “Ahh, the looking pool room! Why didn’t I think of this before?”

The Pool of Visions was a special place where dragons of the past and present could look into in search of any possible answers to what lay ahead in the coming future, or even at the current moment in a faraway land, someone in trouble for example. Of the 4 of them Ignitus by far possessed the most skill at accurately understanding foreseen details, but they were all competent enough to do it in one way or another. Volteer normally didn’t exhibit the degree of fasciation that Ignitus did towards the mystical pool, the main reason why visions didn’t always come out clearly for him, if at all, although today he was determined to sit still and focus… after all, there was nothing else better to do. Being a calculated thinker that he was, thoughts and ideas were nearly always rolling through his mind, which one of them he often practiced when staring into the Pool of Visions was just to pretend to BE Ignitus! “Just be calm and don’t think too much, Volteer…” the guardian, now lying on his belly gazing in the water, murmurs under his breath, “Remember what Iggy says: just empty your mind. Let the visions come to you… and please don’t drink any of it.”

Once giving himself a quick reason to laugh by recalling to the time he nearly took a slurp of the pool’s contents many, many trips around the sun ago, the guardian puts on a serious face for real this time, one enough even for Terrador to be proud of. A very long, deep inhale is taken as he lies in place, and stares directly at the water’s perfectly mirror-esque surface. Not a sound in the chamber nor any movement of air to match, Volteer concentrated with unyielding dedication at staring at his reflection, just the very same spot, with the only time his eyes not looking at the water being the occasional blink. It was a little tricky for even Ignitus to explain to others on how the pool worked exactly, but to Volteer his way of associating it reminded him of an optical illusion puzzle, a game he was always intrigued by.

“Hold it; I… I believe I’m getting something here! Oh great pool of generations past, what is there in store for I, Volteer? Mmm, I can hardly contain my excitement!” Volteer’s tail bouncily swished to and fro. To his delight, right as his eyes began to tire from straining on one point he is allowed to relax them. Indeed, like an optical illusion he lets his eyes slowly draw apart in order to perceive the somewhat blurry image coming into shape, a moving one to be more precise. A vast vantage of a snow-capped mountain range off in the distance was framed on the bottom by the tops of trees coming in one’s direction way down below, looking like no more than clustered heads of broccoli. “My, such an enchanting scene straight out an old tale of lore. An excellent idea! A leisurely flight over the forest would be a splendid way to pass the time! Although… hmm, perhaps not so darned high… how would I enjoy the intricate beauty of the forest flying 150 feet in the air?”

A cheerful, closed-eyes charismatic grin spreads across the yellow drake’s face the moment he stood up, his tail thumping around in the dirt all the while and chest confidently pushed forward. He felt so triumphant, and understandably so! Normally he had a tricky time pulling answers out from the Pool of Visions from his jittery nature, but not this time! “This went so fluidly, so smoothly. I’m getting better at this every time I try it. I can’t wait to tell Ignitus later on, he’ll be surely proud I grasp the concept. Who says an old dog can’t learn new tricks, hm?”

Volteer has a bounce in his step as he heads his way back to the way he entered, only to be halted by a flash of light in the corner of his eye, and reactively does a double take. As quick as his on-top-of-the-world expression formed seconds earlier it is just as instantaneously replaced by a look of mulling curiosity. Over on the opposite side of the room sitting right in the doorway that lead to the large dojo now sat a large, softly glowing crystal. About 2 meters tall, or roughly three-fourths as tall as he was when sitting in a shade of white accented by the occasional glimmer of colorful iridescence, this gem was instant captivation for the electric guardian, already transfixed on its sudden appearance and beauty. So much that he went into brief low-level flight across the relatively small room to get to it faster. “A spirit gem... and one of upmost charm at that! It’s a rare sight to witness one make its premier arrival here on Earth! A gift from our ancestors I've heard… and I believe it! Only a place from beyond this dimension could such a spectacle appear from.”

Though tall, the crystal was no more than 18 inches across at its max width near its top and only a foot at its base, allowing ample space for Volteer to circle around it to admire it from all angles, including its subtle warmth it radiated. “I’ve never seen a white one like this before. Even the whitest snow and most extravagant pearls would be jealous. I thought these only came in red, green, blue or purple. Yes, a lucky find indeed. Ancestors, I bid my thanks.”

A little bit of bitter was added to the sweet, because Volteer remembered that spirit gems needed to be shattered into many pieces to release their power, and this saddened him a little that at some point in the near time he would be destroying it. Or so he thought; when he places his clawed hand to stroke the crystal’s flawlessly smooth surface in a way that spoke, “I’m sorry, friend.” it began to quickly glow intensely… and much to Volteer’s surprise so was his whole arm! He lets out a sharp gasp and slams his eyelids tight at the sudden transfer of heat and power that felt as if it was coursing through every living cell in his being, yet inexplicably he couldn’t bring himself to take his hand away. Thankfully the dramatic intensity eases after the initial burst into an oddly soothing sensation, which tempted Volteer to open his eyes. He felt both apprehensive and intrigued towards the sight of the ethereal white energy swirling into his arm, and remained transfixed until any trace of the gem faded away. In a matter of seconds a spirit gem stood right in front of him, now it’s as if nothing had ever been there at all! “Well that wasn’t according to plan; I WAS going to share...”

Looking himself over, there were no adverse effects to his body from what he could tell, but just to be sure he stepped ahead into the dojo and flew a few laps around the enormous dragon statue that took up a great amount of the room. Corkscrews, barrel rolls, and loops he executed just for good measure, imagining he were performing in an act for all to enjoy, but apart from getting a little dizzy upon landing in front of the doorway he felt fine, great even. In fact, he caught himself again doing something completely out of the ordinary. “I feel wonderful! This day has turned around so astoundingly well that my chest keeps puffing out! Oh, I’m starting to act like Cyril! I’d better be careful; if I were his ego's size I’d match height with the ancestral statue. Haha!”

With those words, a strange tingle overtakes Volteer’s body, his eager smile wiped away by the sensation of lightheadedness, which causes him to rub his eyes and shake his head slowly left and right, realizing maybe he spoke too soon. Both he and the statue were dimly glowing with a whitish aura, a preceding herald to something game-breaking (possible pun intended) about to occur for Dragon Realms.
15421.title: A strange gem...

154212.content:
It was not a common occurrence for Volteer to be rendered speechless, but even one as engaging as him was at a loss for words to what was taking place right before his eyes. The elegantly crafted ancestral statue of times old was shrinking, first pretty slowly and then increasing timely to a steadier speed, eventually diminishing until it matched his height, base and all. The room’s centerpiece now at Volteer’s size made for an empty setting in stark contrast to what he had been used to seeing for many years, both adding strangeness of revealing architectural elements he never really paid attention to and by the echoing hollow sounds, such as the whispering winds, dull thudding of his footsteps, and most apparently his voice. Even speaking to himself at a reasonable level saw his voice carried all around full and clear. “The statue… err, umm, did I do that? This day is becoming more and more uncanny, totally unprecedented in my lifetime experience for sure. Either I need some much needed bedrest like Ignitus—too much boredom CAN yield many side effects, mmhm— or that gem gave me a new power!”

A toothy- grinned glance to the sky with a hand stroking his indigo goatee, Volteer takes a small moment to admire the lichen covered walls adorned with jewels and shrubs growing out some of the cracked stone ledges halfway towards the ceiling, giving marveling testament to how etched in history the temple really was. Moving beyond that, what could now be most appreciated was the wonderfully exquisite stained glass ceiling itself. “Ohh, the time it must have taken to construct such flawless beauty... the way the rainbow-hued sunlight shines through and dances with the moving shadows from the rustling tree limbs along with the silhouettes of carved glass… ah, nature at its finest!” Volteer openly spoke his musings, then shifting his eyes down to the eye level statue in the room’s middle. Immediately his endearing smile faded… “B-But yet how sad that the ancestral statue genuinely robs us of it unless we guardians or the young ones are training… hmm…”

The electric guardian’s resulting heaved sigh is retuned to him via ricocheting off the barren temple’s walls. As much as he wanted to keep things this way in part of the tranquility made by both sight and sound, he knew of the statue’s cultural significance of their past. And to their future too: the statue was synchronized specifically with the floor to sink below the surface, creating room for the dojo arena in the wide space left in its wake. With the statue now shrunk to the size of an average adult dragon, however, who’s to say this carefully timed mechanism still worked properly? Volteer was a renowned guardian; he needed to do and protect what was in the best interest of everyone, not just himself. An infamous yakker he was, yes… but selfish he was not.

“Hopefully the statue shrinking down to my size wasn’t a one time usage only ordeal. Molecular structural alteration of an object to such a degree is in no way weak magic, and it could take great time to find another white crystal. Ages… eras… eons… I-I wouldn’t even know HOW to start explaining my severe mistake to the other guardi-” Volteer pauses to take a deep breath. “No, no, Volteer… collect yourself. No reason to panic, think positive! I very well may have acquired an ability that could last as long as I live. And that’d be something uniquely esoteric!”

The yellow drake knew there was only one way to find out. He tries doing what he figured was most logical by focusing on the stone sculpture and imagining it looking the way it was supposed to. Lo and behold the brightened demeanor Volteer took on when he and the statue took on the familiar ghostly glow; following suit the ground lightly shook as it gradually expanded outward and upward, all the way up to the towering, stately height it had formerly always been. After the glowing ceased, not a scratch, dent, or any other suggested sign of tampering could Volteer find during a quick, rising corkscrew of a flying spot check. “Heeheehaha! A perfect execution both ways! I really CAN control such a power! I always assumed only potions and machines could exploit this principle of matter! The theories, the hypotheses I could think of for hours on end! The fun I could have playing around with this! Who could have thought this dismal day would turn into one of the best days of my life!”

In an overwhelming rush of barely contained bliss, the electric guardian leaps off the statue’s snout and beelines through the passage back into the Pool of Visions room, and just as quickly sails over the aforementioned containment of liquid, his ‘hi!/bye!’ flyby making tiny ripples through its translucent jade surface. Back outside, it was as if not even the nearly wall-to-wall sunshine could measure up to the brightness of his giddy smile. Never mind the calm fly over the forest, he wanted to tell someone about his newfound feature! But who? Terrador wasn’t here since he was with Spyro off somewhere, Volteer having no clue of his return time (even though it could be any time), which meant his best choices were Cyril in the library or Ignitus in his bed chamber. “Who to tell? Who to choose? Ignitus and Cyril both are occupied being by themselves, but I think this qualifies as an exception! Maybe I’ll even show them a personal… demonstration!”

Speeding off in direction back to the main corridors letting off sparks off his body all the while, Volteer made his decision. The lucky dragon he would soon be visiting would turn out to be...
154212.title: The statue shrinks down to his size. He can con...

info.description:
As the title suggests, this is a story which involves the characters from the original "Spyro the dragon" videogames or from the "Legend of Spyro" series.
You can make the character you choose grow huge or shrink, you can also make someone else shrink and make him/her interact with the character you chose.
Everything is allowed, i just don't allow too gross sexual references and toilet references.
I allow violence (if it's not extreme), if you make your character grow he (or she) can rampage, kill, stomp and vore as much as you want.

Hope you like it.
